intro: Adenostemma schimperi, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in cymes. Its latex sap is milky and can be toxic, which is a common feature among plants in the milkweed family. Adenostemma schimperi is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, thriving in tropical and subtropical regions.
